block.p: Laurie Beth Saroff, a legislative counsel for the National League of Cities in Washington, is to be married this afternoon to Dr. Richard Warren Singerman, the president of Bioquest, a biotechnology company in Washington. Rabbi Alvin Berkin is to perform the ceremony at the Tree of Life Synagogue in Pittsburgh.

The bride, 30, graduated from Bryn Mawr College and received a master's degree in public policy from Harvard University. She is a daughter of Prof. Joan Saroff and Dr. Lawrence Saroff of Pittsburgh. Her father is a program manager in the Department of Energy in Washington. Her mother is a professor of developmental studies at Allegheny Community College in Pittsburgh.

The bridegroom, 33, graduated from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and received a Ph.D. in physics from Cornell University. He was a Marshall Scholar at Cambridge University in England. His parents, Marjorie and Millard Singerman, live in Los Angeles, where his father is an accountant.
